content.title: Don't SPAM The Text Messengers, FCC Says - Forbes
content.desc: Despite, or perhaps because of, its simplicity, text messaging is one of the mobile Internet’s most popular applications. And in a new declaratory ruling, the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) is seeking to keep it that way. The key objective is to avoid the scourge of spam that has infected other forms of communication. Vector stock illustration. In 2017, mobile users in the U.S. exchanged 1.77 trillion texts, also know as short message services (SMS) and multimedia message services (MMS). content.title: 'We've hit peak social': Reddit co-founder warns Facebook's days are numbered - The Telegraph
content.desc: The co-founder of the website known as the "front page of the internet" has warned the world is hitting "peak social" as social networks such as Facebook and Twitter near saturation point. Alexis Ohanian, of messaging board site Reddit, said users were increasingly turning off big social networks in favour of private messaging apps. "I really believe that we've hit ... peak social," Mr Ohanian said. "We've reached the ceiling." Social networking sites like Facebook have struggled to add new users in important markets like North American and Europe, although Facebook is still growing rapidly...

content.title: Message service Clickatell considers IPO to fund expansion: CEO - Reuters
content.desc: Clickatell, which helps companies communicate with customers via mobile messaging platforms, is considering a public offering next year as it seeks to fund a rapid expansion of its services, founder and CEO Pieter de Villiers said on Tuesday. Clickatell, which was founded in South Africa but is now based in California, could seek to list on a U.S. exchange, he said. The company initially used mobile phone SMS messaging to enable its clients to communicate directly with their customers.
